decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>No cleaning of masonry, other than low pressure (20-100 psi) surface cleaning using a nebulous water spray is authorised by this consent without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; Before work begins, any other cleaning proposals must be approved in writing and carried out strictly in accordance with those details.&nbsp; At the commencement of the cleaning, a test panel shall be undertaken in an inconspicuous position and the method recorded to the approval of the Local Planning Authority.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained and in accordance with Sections 16 and 17 (1) (a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>No new grilles, satellite dishes, aerials, meter boxes, security alarms, lighting, security or other cameras or other fixtures or plant shall be mounted on the external faces or roof of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained and in accordance with Sections 16 and 17 (1) (a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>Full details, including physical samples for inspection on site, of all the materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including, but not limited to:</p><ul><li>1 metre square sample panels showing the proposed pointing joints, mortar mix, profile and finish;</li><li>all new and replacement bricks;</li><li>all new and replacement slates and tiles;</li><li>all new and replacement zinc roof covering;</li><li>all new and replacement corbels.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>Shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the start of the relevant part of the works. The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained and in accordance with Sections 16 and 17 (1) (a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>No soil stacks, soil vent pipes, plumbing, pipes, flues, vents or ductwork shall be fixed on the external faces of the building other than those shown on the drawings hereby approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained and in accordance with Sections 16 and 17 (1) (a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained and in accordance with Sections 16 and 17 (1) (a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>

<p>All new and replacement external rainwater and soil pipes shall be of traditional design, formed in cast iron and painted black.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that those features which contribute to the special architectural and historic interest of the building are retained and in accordance with Sections 16 and 17 (1) (a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, June 2019, Paragraphs 184 to 202; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</p>
description: External repairs and replacement of parts of the roof, roof parapet, cornice and rainwater goods; repointing and repair of brickwork; repair and redecoration works to windows, painted elements on all elevations, stonework and metalwork; repairs to concrete windows sills and boundary walls and; installation of snow guards.
